channel.title: Help with server hosting?
channel.description:
Whats up guys, Well, I downloaded the Destarrest V1 client + source, then in the client folder I went to the client.java file and put my ip on the line #12793 public static String server = "MY IP HERE"; then I compiled, initialized the source ok....
But I still cant login, the classic "error connecting to server" appears, and I already tried a bunch of things and I'm tired of trying :/ Anyone can help me?
Thanks :o

item.title: Help with server hosting?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

make a client for you to login under 127.0.0.1 otherwise you wont be able to login, and then copy that same client and paste it on your desktop and change the copied client to your no-ip and release it if people still cant connect then your ports aren’t open

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server hosting?
item.dc:creator: @junkfroggy junkfroggy
item.description:
@junkfroggy wrote:

The client should have an area to select the IP to connect to automatically.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server hosting?
item.dc:creator: @The_Viewer The Viewer
item.description:
@The_Viewer wrote:

I am editing the client not the source…
I put my ip but I still cant login, ofc if I put127.0.0.1 i will login but only me, i want make everybody that haves my client login.

Is there something i need to change in the client source too?

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server hosting?
item.dc:creator: @junkfroggy junkfroggy
item.description:
@junkfroggy wrote:

Are you editing the server source, or client?
If client:
Make a version for you (127.0.0.1)
Make a version for the outside world (ipchicken.com)
If server:
I might set it to your outside world address.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server hosting?
item.dc:creator: @The_Viewer The Viewer
item.description:
@The_Viewer wrote:

If I put 127.0.0.1 only me will can make login, no?

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server hosting?
item.dc:creator: @junkfroggy junkfroggy
item.description:
@junkfroggy wrote:

Is your client set to login to 127.0.0.1?

Read full topic
